0.name: Horse
0.notes: weight does not count against encumbrance

1.name: War Horse
1.notes: weight does not count against encumbrance

13.name: First Aid Kit
13.notes: three uses, see Healing on page 96

22.name: Medic Kit
22.notes: Five uses, +1 to Healing skill rolls;$25 refill

44.name: Bipod/Tripod
44.notes: Takes an action to deploy. Negates Recoil and Min Str penalties

45.name: Laser/Red Dot Sight
45.notes: +1 to Shooting at short and medium range'

46.name: Rifle Scope
46.notes: Cancels 2 additional points of penalties when Aiming. See page 97

51.name: Pepper Spray
51.notes: Use Shooting (or Fighting if engaged). No Range penalty, but max range is 2" (about 10 feet), shots 5, victim must make Vigor Roll at -2 or be Stunned (page 106)

52.name: Stun Gun
52.notes: Uses Shooting. Range 1/2/4. Shots 3 before needing to be recharged for at least 2 hours. Victims must make a Vigor roll at -2 or be Stunned (page 106)

56.name: Lineman's Telephone
56.notes: Repair roll to tap into a phone line

57.name: Night Vision Goggles
57.notes: No penalty for dim or dark Illumination (see page 102). For double the price goggles are "active" and ignore all Illumination penalties

58.name: Parabolic Microphone
58.notes: Hear whispers up to 200 yards distance

61.name: Arrows/Bolts
61.notes: Arrows for bows, bolts for crossbows

65.name: Laser Battery (pistol)
65.notes: one full magazine for Laser Pistol

66.name: Laser Battery (rifle/smg)
66.notes: one full magazine for Laser Rifle/SMG

67.name: Laser Battery (Gatling)
67.notes: one full magazine for Laser Gatling gun

72.name: Jacket
72.notes: Heavy winter clothing, supple leather armor, soft hides

73.name: Robes
73.notes: Heavy winter clothing, supple leather armor, soft hides

74.name: Leggings
74.notes: Heavy winter clothing, supple leather armor, soft hides

75.name: Cap
75.notes: Heavy winter clothing, supple leather armor, soft hides

76.name: Jacket
76.notes: Boiled leather, cuir bouilli, alligator hides

77.name: Leggings
77.notes: Boiled leather, cuir bouilli, alligator hides

78.name: Cap
78.notes: Boiled leather, cuir bouilli, alligator hides

79.name: Chain Shirt
79.notes: Chain, splint, metal scale, ring mail, samurai armor

80.name: Chain Leggings
80.notes: Chain, splint, metal scale, ring mail, samurai armor

81.name: Chain Hood or Helm
81.notes: Chain, splint, metal scale, ring mail, samurai armor

82.name: Bronze Barding
82.notes: Typically only found in ancient times or pre-iron civilizations

83.name: Bronze Corselet
83.notes: Typically only found in ancient times or pre-iron civilizations

84.name: Bronze Vambraces
84.notes: Typically only found in ancient times or pre-iron civilizations

85.name: Bronze Greaves
85.notes: Typically only found in ancient times or pre-iron civilizations

86.name: Bronze Helmet
86.notes: Typically only found in ancient times or pre-iron civilizations

87.name: Plate Barding
87.notes: Heavy steel armor made with plates of metal

88.name: Corselet
88.notes: Heavy steel armor made with plates of metal

89.name: Vambraces
89.notes: Heavy steel armor made with plates of metal

90.name: Greaves
90.notes: Heavy steel armor made with plates of metal

91.name: Heavy Helm
91.notes: Heavy steel armor made with plates of metal

92.name: Heavy Helm (enclosed)
92.notes: Heavy steel armor made with plates of metal, -1 to vision based notice rolls

93.name: Thick Coat/Leather Jacket
93.notes: Heavy winter clothing, leather jacket or pants, chaps

94.name: Leather Riding Chaps
94.notes: Heavy winter clothing, leather jacket or pants, chaps

103.name: Bombproof Suit
103.notes: Bombproof suits are not built for flexibility except in the hands, which are uncovered. Agility and related skills that require more than manual dexterity cannot exceed d6 while wearing the suit, and Pace is reduced by 2 (in addition to min Str penalties)

104.name: Energy Skin
104.notes: Any Futuristic can be treated with this to diffuse energy, reducing damage from lasers by 4. This costs 50% of the armor treated and is very shiny, subtracting 2 from stealth rolls based on vision

105.name: Body Armor
105.notes: Light armored clothing made from complex polymers or advanced ballistic weave, blocks 4 points of damage from bullets

106.name: Infantry Battle Suit
106.notes: A full suit of armor with boots and gloves, blocks 4 points of damage from bullets

119.name: Club, Light
119.notes: a sign of low status or thuggery

120.name: Club, Heavy
120.notes: a sign of low status or thuggery

125.name: Lance
125.notes: ap 2 when charging, reach 2, only usable in mounted combat

130.name: Spear
130.notes: reach 1, parry +1 if used two handed, can be thrown

136.name: Bang stick
136.notes: A shotgun shell on a stick used in Melee; must be reloaded with a fresh shell (one action)

137.name: Bayonet
137.notes: str+d6 and Parry +1 attached to rifle, reach 1, two hands

139.name: Brass Knuckles
139.notes: do not count as weapon for unarmed defender (page 109)

142.name: Survival Knife
142.notes: basic tools in handle add +1 to survival rolls

149.name: Crossbow, Heavy
149.notes: requires a windlass to load. Reload 2

151.name: Net (weighted)
151.notes: A successful hit means the target is Entangled (see page 98). Hardness 10, and vulnerable only to cutting attacks

157.name: Blunderbuss
157.notes: Treat as Shotgun, see page 105 Reload 3

169.name: Tommy Gun (.45)
169.notes: May also use a 50 round drum. Increases weight by 2 lbs. and each drum costs $50

175.name: Barrett (.50)
175.notes: Heavy Weapon, Snapfire. Barretts use a 10-shot removable magazine that weighs 2 lbs. when loaded. They are almost always fitted with a  scope.

186.name: Minigun (7.62 mm)
186.notes: minimum rate of fire 3, requires backpack harness with ammo that weighs an additional 85 pounds when full (carries 4000 linked rounds)

195.name: Cannon
195.notes: See canister, Solid Shot, and Shrapnel for additional details. Heavy, Reload 8

196.name: Canister
196.notes: Detonates inside barrel of cannon and fires spray like a giant shotgun. Affects d6 targets in straight line up to 24", or 2d6 if they're tightly packed. Compare shooting roll to every target at base TN of 4, adjusted for cover, Dodge, etc.

197.name: Solid Shot
197.notes: Heavy balls of iron, lead, or stone designed to batter walls or plow through ranks of troops. To fire, leader makes a shooting roll. If successful, roll a die. If even, it bounces to another victim behind and within 6" of target - continue until the die roll is odd or no more targets

198.name: Shrapnel
198.notes: Explosive shells filled with small metal balls that explode outward

199.name: Catapult
199.notes: heavy, reload time is 5 minutes with a crew of 4

200.name: Trebuchet
200.notes: heavy, reload time is 5 minutes with a crew of 4

201.name: Flamethrower
201.notes: Heavy, cone template, may be evaded, sets flammable targets on fire (see Fire, page 127)

202.name: MK II (WW2 Pineapple)
202.notes: Heavy, thrown, may be evaded (unless cooked)

203.name: Potato Masher (WW2)
203.notes: Heavy, thrown, may be evaded (unless cooked)

204.name: Mk67
204.notes: Heavy, thrown, may be evaded (unless cooked)

205.name: Smoke Grenade
205.notes: Creates an area of smoke in a LBT that obscures vision at -4

206.name: Stun Grenade
206.notes: Targets must make a Vigor roll (at -2 with a raise) or be Stunned (see page 106)

208.name: Anti-Tank Mine
208.notes: Heavy, AP 5 vs 1/2 the vehicle's Armor value (round up)

209.name: Bouncing Betty
209.notes: These deadly AP mines are designed to pop up into the air and rain shrapnel down from about head-height. Only full overhead cover offers an Armor bonus against such devices. Simply being prone offers no protection)

210.name: Claymore Mine
210.notes: Claymores fire a spray of deadly steel balls in a 60 degree frontal arc. Everyone within 12" is automatically hit. Roll a die for all other targets up to 50'. Those who get an odd result are also hit

211.name: TOW
211.notes: Heavy, wire guided. Doesn't require lock, just point and shoot. Can't be jammed

214.name: Sparrow
214.notes: Heavy, medium range, radar guided from aircraft

216.name: Bazooka
216.notes: Heavy, snapfire, standard WWII anti tank weapon. Extra warheads are 9 lbs. and cost 50 (WW2 dollars)

217.name: M203 40MM
217.notes: Heavy, Snapfire, grenade launcher attached to bottom of assault rifle

218.name: M72 Law
218.notes: Heavy, snapfire, standard anti tank weapon in Vietnam

219.name: Panzerschreck
219.notes: Heavy, snapfire, literally the tank terror rocket launcher used by the Germans in WW2

224.name: Heavy Flamethrower
224.notes: cone template or MBT up to 18" distant

238.name: Bicycle
238.notes: 50% chance shot strikes rider instead. Double's rider's pace and running die result

239.name: Carriage
239.notes: Passengers available up to 3 persons. Can increase comfort for up to 2000 extra. Pulled by one Horse, see page 184. Pace on the tabletop is 12 and it may run

240.name: Early Car
240.notes: Up to 3 passengers. Model Ts and the like

241.name: Street Bike
241.notes: motorbike designed for urban use, can have 1 additional passenger

242.name: Dirt Bike
242.notes: designed for off road use with excellent shocks. Treat as 4WD when off road.

243.name: Compact Car
243.notes: Honda civic or similar. Can have up to 3 passengers

244.name: Mid-Sized Car
244.notes: Air bags, luxury features, up to 4 passengers

245.name: Minivan
245.notes: Typical family mini-van. Air bags, some luxury features, up to 7 passengers

247.name: Sports Car
247.notes: Mustang or similar stock sports cars. Up to 300k for some models - GM should change cost based on model

248.name: Semi-Truck
248.notes: Trailer is size 7, toughness 14(2). Handling with trailer attached is -2

249.name: Jeep
249.notes: 4WD, Driver+Gunman+3 passengers. Weapons: Heavy MG (front pintle mount)

250.name: M4 Sherman
250.notes: Heavy armor, tracked. Weapons: 75mm Tank gun (turret, stabilizer), medium MG(fixed front), Heavy MG(pintle mount on turret)

251.name: M5A1 Stuart
251.notes: Heavy armor, Tracked. Weapons: 37mm tank gun (turret, stabilizer), Medium MG(front fixed), Heavy MG(pintle mount on turret)

252.name: T-34/76
252.notes: Heavy armor, Sloped Armor (front only), Tracked. Weapons: 76mm Tank Gun (turret), Medium MG(Front Fixed and in Turret)

253.name: Pz IVJ
253.notes: Heavy armor, Tracked. Weapons (75mm gun (turret), Medium MG(front fixed and in turret)

254.name: PzVI Tiger II
254.notes: Heavy Armor, Tracked. Weapons 88mm tank gun(turret), medium mg (front fixed and in Turret)

255.name: M1A1 Abrams
255.notes: Heavy Armor, Night Vision, Tracked Weapons: 120mm tank gun (Imp Stabilizer), Medium MG (Front Fixed and in Turret), Heavy MG (Pintle Mount on Turret).

256.name: M2 Bradley
256.notes:
7 passengers, Heavy Armor, Night Vision, Tracked. Weapons: 25mm Autocannon (Imp Stabilizer),
Medium MG (In Turret), TOW Launcher.

257.name: T-72 MBT
257.notes: Heavy Armor, Tracked. Weapons: 125mm tank gun, Medium MG (In Turret), Heavy MG(Pintle Mount on Turret).

258.name: T-80 MBT
258.notes: Heavy Armor, Night Vision, Tracked. Weapons: 125mm tank gun (Improved Stabilizer), Medium MG (In Turret), Heavy MG (Pintle Mount on Turret).

259.name: BTR 70 APC
259.notes: Amphibious, Four-Wheel Drive, Heavy Armor. Weapons: Heavy MG (Turret), Medium MG (Turret)

260.name: Hover Tank
260.notes: Heavy Armor, Hover, Night Vision. Weapons: Heavy Laser (Turret, Improved Stabilizer), Gatling Laser (Fixed Front, Reaction Fire).

261.name: Hover APC
261.notes: 14 Passengers, Heavy Armor, Hover. Weapons: Gatling Laser (Fixed Front, Reaction Fire).

267.name: B17 Flying Fortress
267.notes: Heavy MG (Fixed front), 2× Linked Heavy MG (Top Turret), 2× Linked Heavy, MG (Ball Turret), Heavy MG (Fixed Left), Heavy MG (Fixed Right), Bombs.

268.name: BF-109
268.notes: 20mm Cannon (Fixed Front), 2× Linked Heavy MG (Fixed Front).

270.name: Japanese Zero
270.notes: 2× Linked Medium MGs (Fixed Front), 2× Linked 20mm Cannons (Fixed Front)

272.name: AH-64 Apache
272.notes: Helicopter, Night Vision. Weapons: 30mm Cannon (Fixed Front), 16× Hellfire Missiles

273.name: AV-8B Harrier
273.notes: –1 Handling when in VTOL mode. Weapons: 25mm Cannon (Fixed Front), 2× Sidewinder Missiles, Bombs

274.name: F-15 Eagle
274.notes: Night Vision. Weapons: 20mm Cannon (Fixed Front), 4× Sidewinder Missiles, 4× Sparrow Missiles, Bombs.

275.name: SU-27
275.notes: Night Vision. Weapons: 30mm Cannon (Fixed Front), 4× Sidewinder Missiles (Soviet equivalent).

276.name: UH-1 (Huey)
276.notes: 12 Passengers, Helicopter. Weapons: Medium MG (Fixed Left or Right).

277.name: Galleon
277.notes: 80 passengers, Heavy Armor. Weapons: 16× to 46× Cannon (Fixed Left and Right).

278.name: Galley
278.notes: 100 passengers, Heavy Armor. Has both oars and sails. Weapons: Catapult (Fixed Front).

280.name: Patrol Boat, River
280.notes: Heavy Armor. Weapons: 2× Linked Heavy MG (Front Pintle Mount), 2× Medium (Left and Right), Heavy MG (Stern).

281.name: PT Boat (WW2)
281.notes: Heavy Armor. Weapons: 50 cal MG (Front Pintle Mount), Heavy MG (Rear Pintle Mount), 4× torpedo tubes (Fixed Forward).
